name: Sucrose

phaseTransitions.decompositionNote: Decomposes at ~186°C (melts and caramelizes); does not boil - decomposes before boiling

safetyNotes: Generally safe; provides dietary calories; excessive consumption linked to health issues; caramelized sugar can cause severe burns
educationalNotes: Does not have a normal boiling point - decomposes into caramel before boiling! Melts at 186°C. When heated, sucrose breaks down into glucose + fructose, then further decomposes into hundreds of flavor/color compounds (caramelization). Solubility in water increases dramatically with temperature (180g/100mL at 0°C → 487g/100mL at 100°C).
